title: Balance memo
body:
Hi team,

See below a summary of why Iâ€™m excited about Balance. The goal is twofold: 1) for me to really structure my thoughts and why I have conviction 2) for internal communication and alignment so everyone can build their own view/challenge mine.** 
 **

Simply put, Richard wants to build the consumer interface to interact and benefit from the wave of decentralised protocols and their associated tokens. Heâ€™s particularly interested in the economic protocols that are lowering the barriers of access to financial services creating what he calls â€œopen-source bankingâ€. He thinks that the biggest benefit of Bitcoin and its wide adoption as the equivalent of digital gold has created a system allowing anyone to participate into financial services. Open-source banking is not the future, itâ€™s already happening. He makes an interesting comparison with the neobanks. They all had to raise a lot of money to issue cards and progressively move people to their current account. In the meantime, multiple ethereum wallets have attracted billions under management almost â€œovernightâ€â€¦ Obviously this analogy has its limits as in todayâ€™s world you can do more things with the fiat money on a neobank card than with any tokens but still itâ€™s an interesting perspective on this new world.

His long term vision is to build a Distributed Autonomous Bank. He explains it [here](https://medium.com/balance-io/distributed-autonomous-banks-dabs-90701f5758d5). I recommend you to read the post as he touches on KYC, custody, recoverability, (@Remus I know you were interested in these topics). As you will see, several of the building blocks to achieve that vision are work-in-progress and Balance is not trying to do it all so a potential investment is also a wider bet on this market continuing to develop.Â 

So what are they building?** 
 **

[Balance manager](https://manager.balance.io/): The first product they released is Manager, a desktop tool allowing you to send, receive and exchange tokens by connecting you to different wallets (where you actually store your tokens). Manager currently supports Metamask (the largest browser wallet), Ledger and Trezor, the two most popular hardware wallet (cold storage). It now also supports WalletConnect which has also been built by the Balance team. I highly recommend you try it, while still early and basic, I find it a really great UX and the best way to start buying all sorts of ERC-20 tokens. If you have dealt with Metamask before, you will see a huge difference.

[WalletConnect](https://walletconnect.org/): Itâ€™s been incubated by Richard and his team and they have now created a separate non-profit entity that should benefit the whole industry. Itâ€™s an open-source standard for connecting desktop Dapps to mobile Wallets using end-to-end encryption by scanning a QR code. Itâ€™s a great way for users to use/interact with Dapp without compromising their private key as they can just sign/approve any transaction on their mobile wallet. So far, people have mostly used their tokens for speculation but as people start to stake, vote, pay, etc they will be using their tokens and â€œsigningâ€ transactions all the time. You need an easy and secure way for people to approve/sign without compromising private keys. The goal is for as many dapps as possible to support it and make it the Bluetooth for decentralised applications. [Pedro Gomes](https://twitter.com/pedrouid?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor) who was a Balance engineer is now doing this full-time and Richard sits on the board but itâ€™s clearly separate from Balance (so not something we would be investing in). I think itâ€™s interesting because it says a lot about the team: their focus on creating great UI/UX without compromising security, their interest in contributing to the whole industry, the fact that they are not exclusively driven by money and their ability to execute (they have shipped this in a few weeks.Â ** 
 **

*â€œYour phone has your wallet that securely stores your private keys. When you want to interact with a dapp on the web you scan a QR code to link your wallet to the dapp. When you want to make a transaction it pushes a notification to your phone where you can confirm or reject the transaction.â€*** 
 **

In 2018, they want to have 5 wallets and 50 dapps supporting it, they have already signed up ImToken, 0x and Dharma protocols as partners. They have also secured a $150k grant from the Ethereum foundation.Â 

See a demo by a team working on an identity protocol and using wallet connect:** 
 **

*[How you could login and pay for Netflix in web 3.0 era](https://twitter.com/pet3rpan_/status/1030011892981481472)*Â 

You can read more about it here: <https://medium.com/balance-io/walletbridge-a-simple-way-for-web-based-dapps-to-talk-to-mobile-wallets-5c4015f1838c>

<https://medium.com/balance-io/0x-dharma-imtoken-join-walletconnect-87a3dd4dea8d>

[Balance Wallet](https://balance.io/): A [non-custodian](https://medium.com/guarda/%EF%B8%8Fcustodial-vs-non-custodial-wallet-s-%EF%B8%8F-benefits-of-light-wallets-87cf701054d1) mobile wallet for iOS and Android. This is where you store your funds, tokens and collectibles and interact with them. First of all, I think itâ€™s worth mentioning that the word â€œwalletâ€ is probably a bit misleading or at least restrictive. The â€œbrowserâ€ analogy gives a more comprehensive view of the role of such a product. This is where you will interact with these tokens and dapps, approving signature, staking, etc. If Richardâ€™s vision materialise you could apply for a loan, participates into a prediction market like Augur, etc** 
 **

> Chemistry questions:** 
 **

1. *Vision: \*What do they believe that is not visible (yet) to others?*

*That assets like Bitcoin and ETH and other new emerging economic protocols are creating a new open source and fairer banking system. This industry requires UI and UX innovation to attract million of users creating an opportunity to build a new kind of organisation that will become the gateway for people to participate into this alternative financial services industry.*Â 

2. *Market: What happens if they are right and can deliver? How big can this be?*

*Weâ€™re talking about creating a â€œbankâ€ for this new & alternative financial services industry that is global and borderless.*Â 

3. *Product: With a team of 3-4, they have built and released 2 Balance products: desktop manager and a mobile non-custodian wallet (in beta, not on the appstore yet) as well as an open-source standard for dapps to communicate with mobile wallets that is quickly being adopted by the wider industry, WalletConnect.*
4. 
5. *Team: What is special about [the team](https://balance.io/about/)? Why them?*
   1. *[Christian Baroni](https://baroni.co/), design ex-Stripe*
   2. *[Jin Chung](https://www.linkedin.com/in/jinchung17), lead engineer, ex-machine learning infrastructure at eBay*
   3. *Richard Burton, ex Stripe, Ethereum*

      ** 
 **
6. *Timing: why now?*Â 

*The crazy 2017 bull market around cryptoassets has attracted massive inflow of capital and talent into the industry. There are now a very large number of teams working on building new protocols. Most of these protocols have economic incentives tied to it. Bitcoin and Ethereum have made money programmable. Itâ€™s becoming clear that new interfaces and UX standards will be required to embark the next wave of millions of users on these protocols and benefit from them. From another angle, as our life becomes increasingly digital and people are pushing more decentralisation, a digital wallet for decentralised protocols will become a key product for web 3.0*

> Why Iâ€™m excited

I think Balance has the potential to become an iconic product in web 3.0 and technological breakthrough that crypto represents. I agree with Richard that in the near future, the use cases enabled by crypto are likely to be closely related to money and some kind of financial services. Bitcoin and Ethereum have made money and value programmable. Economic incentives are inherent to most of the protocols being built. Weâ€™re seeing a new sort of financial services industry being built. I donâ€™t expect this category to entirely replace the existing banking sector (at least not in the next 10-20 years?) but it will provide new assets, applications and services (e.g. Bitcoin as a reserve value, prediction markets, tokenized assets, Cryptokitties and others as forms of digitally scarce collectibles, etc). As it was the case with the Internet and the Web when browsers that were the first to add graphics and hyperlinks helped embark the next generation of users, new interfaces are needed to transition from niches uses of decentralised protocols to mass-market appeal.Â  The bet here is that the equivalent of the browser will be the â€œwalletâ€. Digital wallets are increasingly becoming a key part of our digital and physical life. They already are in China where Wechat can be considered the equivalent of a digital wallet and that is clearly where Coinbase is moving to as well with the [rebrand of Toshi into Coinbase Wallet](https://blog.coinbase.com/goodbye-toshi-hello-coinbase-wallet-the-easiest-and-most-secure-crypto-wallet-and-browser-4ba6e52e4913) incl chat functionality (and why David Marcus left the board as Facebook is working on their own initiative). Balance is focused on building the most elegant and useful mobile wallet for interacting with economics protocols. Whether the open source banking vision materialises or not, I think backing a great product team building a digital wallet in a very unique way makes a lot sense.** 
 **

The team...My conviction is largely based on Richard as a very unique individual. Iâ€™m intrigued and fascinated by his journey/quest and have been very impressed by his trajectory in the last 12 months. I have seen how his vision, energy and determination have all come together to make some decisions (stop remote working with decentralised team) and start to ship some really interesting products while becoming extremely visible in the space and publishing some great content. His productivity in the last 2-3 months has been insane.Â  I have never seen a more missionary founder than him. As a result, he can be very intense and I suspect itâ€™s not always easy to work with him but I have no doubt about his integrity. Heâ€™s honest, generous and not doing this for the money.Â 

Risks:Â ** 
 **

* Market: there is a big macro risk in this industry due to volatility, regulation, etc.
* Competition: There are a lot of crypto wallets out there. The main competitor is Coinbase. They are already the leaders in converting people from fiat to crypto via their main product. With the Toshi app that has just been rebranded to Coinbase wallet this week, they are moving into Balance territory. Coinbase has demonstrated an amazing ability to execute (e.g. one of the few exchanges that hasnâ€™t been hacked) and buying a lot of teams/talent. However, there are some reasons why I think Balance is unique and could thrive. Coinbase wallet is one project among many others at Coinbase (between their retail product, institutional platforms, etc), they are already a large company doing lots of things and â€œstuckâ€ into a very profitable business model. Then, and more importantly, Coinbase is effectively rebuilding a centralised bank. Anyone who has tried to withdraw money from their accounts can testify that itâ€™s not straightforward, youâ€™re not really in control. While their mission to build a more open financial system is very similar to Balance, there is a fundamental philosophical difference that will impact their product, their talent, their culture. Balance wants to build an open-source and decentralised bank. Their code is already completely open source. In a way Coinbase is still very much a web 2.0 company building on web 3.0 tech (which is why they are pushing their wallet as their web 3.0 product), Balance wants to be the native wallet for web 3.0. The opportunity to back a talented team and company wanting to challenge Coinbase with a fundamentally different and ambitious approach and philosophy is I think extremely exciting (but obviously hard)
* Technological risks: The success of Balance will depend on the success of projects and the continued development of the decentralised architecture. These economic protocols will have to work and deliver real value beyond speculation and a lot of the building blocks for an open and decentralised financial system like identity, recoverability, etc are still being built.Â 
* Richard: I think heâ€™s a total outlier and heâ€™s a big reason for my excitement but I also think his personality could be a challenge. I trust his values and intentions but he is very intense, opinionated,Â  etc and is very open about his personal challenges.

Fund returner: there is no clear business model yet. Because of the competition and Richardâ€™s philosophy we shouldnâ€™t expect them to simply charge fees on each transaction like Coinbase. However, if they become the gateway into economic protocols and attract millions of users, I have no doubt they will capture some important value. Great UI and consumer products will be rewarded. He wrote a great blog post about the business model and his emerging ideas, presenting hash fees as the new cash flow source. They want to support the protocols that have the potential to generate positive hashflow and by bringing people through these protocols help increase the amount of hashes flowing through and eventually capturing some of it. More details [here](https://medium.com/balance-io/hashflow-cashflow-7058fb60ddc5).Â

title: Crowdfund: The Fabric of Life
body:
## Intro

The â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ NFT collection is a gift from mother earth to your inner child forever. Each piece is a reflection of her children's true essence and represents an emotion we have shared with our parents and grandparents. Together in unity here and now, we celebrate the â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ and your existence in the first dimension, by looking into the mirror of the second dimension we are reminded how to be evolution, patient, and kind. In the third dimension, we are introduced to the concept of time by remembering the past, present, and future and with our emotions and in this fourth dimension, the â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ DAO has the purpose of creating digital art in the metaverse and a mission of creating a different kind of buzz...

We intend on co-creating a message of love, balanced emotions, and a â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ fairy tale with NFTâ€™s for â€Little Peopleâ€ everywhere to enjoy for the rest of time. After the collection of 111 â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ NFTâ€™s have been released we also intend on using the collection for a book and card game launch.

## The Artist

The RonX111 collection is slowly being released on two platforms Rarible and OpenSea. RonX111 is an authentic street artist with all prints and holding the stencils, as well as the actual original artworks. RonX111 was born in Australia and is a street activist, he has a primary focus on bringing balance to all and ensuring the things he loves from family to nature are preserved. He has the ability to make immediate and concrete moves if he believes his higher level is at risk.

RonX111 uses nature and the leading street artists in the world to deliver very timely and deep messages for all, even if it takes time to understand the message being delivered. He sees nature in ways many do not like itâ€™s the thing that brings light to his dark nights and the Sun is what reactivates Ron back into the reality that we all live in. His messages can be very kind and very hard it depends on the temperature of the moment. RonX111 is focused on mother nature, protecting and fighting for the greater universe that will be left in place, not fighting for today he fights for years ahead and every action has a consequence.

[Mirror](https://ronx111.com)

## The Animator

Destrola who is in partnership with RonX111 is the animation artist. Together they take the original art to animation for the NFT market, while they still focus on their unique crafts globally. Consider the life of a Destrola as a curious child, one in which every day was another opportunity to understand and evolve the world around them. Now imagine that child always blending into the background; never defining who they are and usually playing second fiddle to friends and family.

At a certain point, there is a switch and drive to move out of the shadows. In this successful venture, they redefine themselves and realize that they have a knack for understanding perceptions and can use their skills to influence that. Moving forward Destrola forges a career in animation and design; spending time with clients to understand the questions that need to be asked and creating solutions that answer them. At the age of 23 Destrola starts pivoting into the realm of education and became a lecturer and tutor at a university; reevaluating the base understandings and helping students begin to question their own perspective of the world through their designs and creations.

[Mirror](https://www.destrola.com)

## RISE: Humboldt Grace Fire Recovery Project

Remembering the Wildfires that devastated their homeland of Australia in 2020, sitting idly by was not an option. [Cannabis Art Guild](http://Cannabisartguild.org) will be Auctioning off â€œRISEâ€ between October 1st - November 30th, 2021 with 100% of proceeds going to the [Humboldt Grace Fire Recovery Project.](https://humboldtgrace.org/fire-recovery/) When legendary street artist RonX111 and world-class animator Destrola became aware of the Humboldt Grace Fire Recovery Project they sprung into action creating these special 1 of 1 Charitable NFT collections.

title: Inflatie
body:
De inflatie in de eurozone is deze maand toegenomen tot 4,1 procent op jaarbasis, meldt het Europees statistiekbureau Eurostat op basis van voorlopige cijfers. Sinds juli 2008 was de geldontwaarding niet meer zo hoog. De sterk gestegen energieprijzen zijn de belangrijkste oorzaak van de hogere inflatie. Ten opzichte van vorig jaar oktober werd energie 23,5 procent duurder.

De inflatie loopt daarmee verderop, aangezien het percentage in september nog 3,4 procent was. Volgens Eurostat komt de inflatie in Nederland in oktober uit op 3,8 procent, een toename van 0,8 procent. Daarmee presteert ons land beter dan buurlanden BelgiÃ« en Duitsland, waar de inflatie naar verwachting uit komt op respectievelijk 5,4 en 4,6 procent.

In andere grote economieÃ«n, waaronder ItaliÃ« en Frankrijk, valt geldontwaarding lager uit. De Baltische staten en Spanje krijgen in oktober te maken met de hoogste inflatie, terwijl in Portugal en Mala de inflatie onder de 2 procent blijft.

## Intro

The â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ NFT collection is a gift from mother earth to your inner child forever. Each piece is a reflection of her children's true essence and represents an emotion we have shared with our parents and grandparents. Together in unity here and now, we celebrate the â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ and your existence in the first dimension, by looking into the mirror of the second dimension we are reminded how to be evolution, patient, and kind. In the third dimension, we are introduced to the concept of time by remembering the past, present, and future and with our emotions and in this fourth dimension, the â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ DAO has the purpose of creating digital art in the metaverse and a mission of creating a different kind of buzz...

We intend on co-creating a message of love, balanced emotions, and a â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ fairy tale with NFTâ€™s for â€Little Peopleâ€ everywhere to enjoy for the rest of time. After the collection of 111 â€œFabric of Lifeâ€ NFTâ€™s have been released we also intend on using the collection for a book and card game launch.

## The Artist

The RonX111 collection is slowly being released on two platforms Rarible and OpenSea. RonX111 is an authentic street artist with all prints and holding the stencils, as well as the actual original artworks. RonX111 was born in Australia and is a street activist, he has a primary focus on bringing balance to all and ensuring the things he loves from family to nature are preserved. He has the ability to make immediate and concrete moves if he believes his higher level is at risk.

RonX111 uses nature and the leading street artists in the world to deliver very timely and deep messages for all, even if it takes time to understand the message being delivered. He sees nature in ways many do not like itâ€™s the thing that brings light to his dark nights and the Sun is what reactivates Ron back into the reality that we all live in. His messages can be very kind and very hard it depends on the temperature of the moment. RonX111 is focused on mother nature, protecting and fighting for the greater universe that will be left in place, not fighting for today he fights for years ahead and every action has a consequence.

[Mirror](https://ronx111.com)

## The Animator

Destrola who is in partnership with RonX111 is the animation artist. Together they take the original art to animation for the NFT market, while they still focus on their unique crafts globally. Consider the life of a Destrola as a curious child, one in which every day was another opportunity to understand and evolve the world around them. Now imagine that child always blending into the background; never defining who they are and usually playing second fiddle to friends and family.

At a certain point, there is a switch and drive to move out of the shadows. In this successful venture, they redefine themselves and realize that they have a knack for understanding perceptions and can use their skills to influence that. Moving forward Destrola forges a career in animation and design; spending time with clients to understand the questions that need to be asked and creating solutions that answer them. At the age of 23 Destrola starts pivoting into the realm of education and became a lecturer and tutor at a university; reevaluating the base understandings and helping students begin to question their own perspective of the world through their designs and creations.

title: Catshuis
body:
Het demissionaire kabinet bespreekt vrijdag op het Catshuis wat er gedaan moet worden naar aanleiding van de oplopende coronacijfers. Deskundigen praten de bewindslieden bij over de huidige situatie en het advies vanuit het Outbreak Management Team (OMT), dat donderdag al bijeenkwam. Er liggen nog veel opties op tafel.

Bij het Catshuisoverleg worden meestal de grote lijnen voor het coronabeleid uitgezet. Doorgaans vindt de vergadering plaats op zondag, maar demissionair premier Mark Rutte en demissionair minister van FinanciÃ«n Wopke Hoekstra reizen zaterdag af naar de G20-top in Rome.

Bronnen melden dat het kabinet openstaat voor een breed scala aan stappen. Zo wil demissionair minister Hugo de Jonge (Volksgezondheid) niet uitsluiten dat er maatregelen komen die alleen gericht zijn op ongevaccineerden. Ook de mogelijkheid om regionaal in te grijpen, ligt weer op tafel.

Daar werd tot nu toe van afgezien, onder meer omdat dat zou kunnen leiden tot problemen met de handhaving en omdat mensen in een klein land als Nederland makkelijk tussen regio's reizen. Het OMT-advies over maatregelen zal een centrale rol spelen in de keuzes die uiteindelijk gemaakt worden.

title: OHM token strategy
body:
I recently got into OHM, the native token for Olympus DAO. Hearing the develop on the Bankless podcast helped me feel a bit better about owning their token and using the platform. Last year I bought CRV and MIR tokens, of which iâ€™ve been holding CRV on Aave to get a reasonable APR%, and for MIR iâ€™ve staked a good chunk on their platform and received huge rewards for the first few months, 400-700% APR, which slowly trickled down to a nice 50% APR for the past few months. CRV is obviously huge for enabling layered DeFi assets and providing stablecoins to the masses, and developers, but MIR is less known as it connects with the Terra blockchain ecosystem. Terra has proven itself worthy with the rise of its LUNA native token, and its stablecoin becoming widely used throughout all of crypto. Having experienced new aspects of DeFi, and CeFi with the likes of NEXO, Iâ€™m on the look out for the next step in this space and I think OHM is really important right now.

With 8,000% APR, OHM is impossible to pass up at this moment in time. Even better, OHM doesnâ€™t require the usage of Uniswap to create itâ€™s LP; this means you only need to buy OHM to create the LP token, thereâ€™s no need to add ETH or some stablecoin. Iâ€™m personally not interested in adding my ETH to any sort of liquidity pool system for the foreseeable future -- So, not having to add ETH or some stablecoin to create an LP token on the Olympus DAO protocol is a huge thumbs up for me. Iâ€™ve purchased about 10 OHM tokens and subsequently staked them for about 2 weeks. As such iâ€™ve gotten roughly 2 OHM as rewards during that time.

My experience holding MIR token for the past year gives me hope that projects like OHM will at least last longer than one year and will become increasingly profitable over time using this strategy: Buy the token, stake it for a year, unstake it and then sell for a stablecoin. Depending on how you feel about the project after 1 year, you can continue to stake for another year, or cash in and move on to something else. Hopefully within that 1 year time frame the asset has at least doubled, 100% increase, or more then thatâ€™s a great investment to be had! The rewards you collected will need to be sold 1 year after you obtained them, which might be difficult to calculate for each protocol, but ultimately these assets *are* capital gains related and should be taxed as such. Keep this in mind. 

OHM has a great feature in that you can connect to Fuse on Rari Capital and use your sOHM tokens as collateral for a loan in USDC/DAI ! This is crazy good, as i can take my rewards for staking OHM, take a loan out on them, and use it for whatever else i need! If anything I could sent it to NEXO and get 10% interest or take a loan out on it as a direct deposit into my checking/debit account. 

I love DeFi and am excited to see what else happens in the coming year!

title: Mint prices should be in fiat, not crypto.
body:
## At least for most projects out there! 

A couple of weeks ago, we wrote a comprehensive post outlining what we believe is a worrying development in the NFT space. ICYMI, read up on it here: 

[https://mirror.xyz/0x473803aBB217127321fcF961830E6E31192e7083/uKq19v3FRbUZz1xRjYlFgVqWGYjjp4K213rUIXZmLqg](https://mirror.xyz/0x473803aBB217127321fcF961830E6E31192e7083/uKq19v3FRbUZz1xRjYlFgVqWGYjjp4K213rUIXZmLqg)

With the recent bull run of crypto currencies in general and Ethereum, that is host to most NFT projects, in particular, we see the main premise of our post confirmed: That in fact, mint prices for NFT projects are entirely disconnected from reality. Now that ETH price has risen significantly, floor prices of countless NFT projects are dropping. Obviously, there are some other factors at play, but rising ETH prices should explain at least a good chunk of the variance.  
  
 Of course, we are not only running our own project with the Ghostwriters Guild, but are also active members of various other NFT communities. We are generally interested in knowing whatâ€™s going on in the space and itâ€™s important to us to critically evaluate what makes projects valueable and legitimate and draw our own conclusions. One of the questions we have asked ourselves countless times is why mint prices are set in **ETH and not in say, fiat.** With the recent surge, this has become more relevant than ever. 

There are two obvious and some less obvious answers to this question. The most obvious ones being â€œ*fuck fiat!*â€ and â€œ*youâ€™re paying to mint in ETH anyway, so thatâ€™s naturally the currency prices are set in*â€. One emotional and one seemingly logical response. But both hypothetical responses would be missing the point: Weâ€™re not asking why *payment* is in ETH, but rather why the *value of the NFT* is denominated in ETH. A very important distinction which is highlighted by the following question Iâ€™ve seen asked in a very popular NFT project (and which hasnâ€™t received any response yet). 

![A question that was posted in the discord of a very popular NFT project](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/j7Fu121Rp7RP8CwFCt0pB.JPG?height=83&width=606)

The user asks a legitimate question and the answer isnâ€™t entirely straight-forward. There are only two logical scenarios from a projectâ€™s standpoint: 

**Scenario 1** 

The projectâ€™s expenses are all calculated and paid for in ETH. The project pays devs, artists and for the entire infrastructure in ETH. In this case, it would be somewhat reasonable to set NFT values in ETH and not make any changes regardless of the price flactuation. The project owners / collaborators would assume the risk of the price fluctuation which could be considered fair to some degree. 

**Scenario 2**

The projects expenses are calculated and paid for in fiat. In this case, it is only reasonable to adjust mint prices based on the initial calculation â€“ lowering the mint price in a bull market and increasing it in a bear market. 

## Reality checking NFT projects. 

In fact, we have seen scenario 2 play out various times in projects that we have been involved in as community members, which does beg the questions: Why did these projects denominate their NFTâ€™s value in ETH to begin with? If youâ€™re changing the mint fee in accordance to current ETH prices, youâ€™re essentially admitting that youâ€™ve been calculating in fiat all along. So naturally, wouldnâ€™t it be reasonable for both, transparencyâ€™s sake and for the sake of your own financial planning to set fixed prices in fiat currency and adjust to whatever that translates into ahead of the mint? 

We have made the experience that most expenses for NFT projects, an the Ghostwriters Guild is no exception, have to be actually paid in fiat currencies. Weâ€™re paying for web services, developers, artists and smaller expenses like discord server boosts in USD or EUR. For our project, neither a fixed nor a flexible ETH price set in advance would make any sense really and as such, we will be issuing the price for our PFP collection in USD and to whatever number that translates to in ETH once mint date rolls around. Payment will still place in ETH â€“ naturally.
